snippet: Unlike R-rated movies or a learner’s permit, there are no clear rules that dictate when a child can or should have a phone.
abstract: Sam Grobart Tool Kit column observes that unlike R-rated movies or a learner’s permit, there are no clear rules that dictate when a child can or should have a cellphone; notes a consensus is developing around the 11- to 13-year-old range for their first phone.
lead_paragraph: Unlike R-rated movies or a learner’s permit, there are no clear rules that dictate when a child can or should have a phone.

headline.seo: Weighing When a Child Is Old Enough for a Cellphone
headline.main: Johnny’s First Phone: A Guide for Parents
